questions.question: Is the blue herringbone-textured jacket retained in the edited image?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the cartoonish owl character wears a blue jacket, but there is no visible herringbone texture. The texture seen in Image A, which has detailed fabric patterns, is absent in the hand-drawn style of Image B.

questions.question: Are the collar and lapel shape of the blue jacket preserved in the edited image?
questions.explanation: Image A shows a clear collar and lapel design typical of a formal jacket. In Image B, the owl's jacket does have a collar and lapel, resembling the general style but not identical in shape due to the simplified, cartoonish representation.

questions.question: Are two microphones visible in front of the speaker in the edited image?
questions.explanation: Image A shows two microphones in front of the speaker. In Image B, there is no representation of microphones, as it is a cartoon drawing focusing on an owl character, with no podium or microphones depicted.

questions.question: Is the speaker’s right hand raised with an open palm in the edited image?
questions.explanation: In Image A, the speaker's right hand is visible and raised with an open palm. In Image B, the owl’s right 'hand' or wing is raised and open, mimicking a similar gesture. Despite the stylistic difference, the basic gesture is retained.

questions.question: Is the circular emblem with a blue center, gold border, and star pattern visible on the podium in the edited image?
questions.explanation: Image A has a podium with an emblem featuring a blue center, gold border, and star pattern. Image B, being a cartoon illustration, does not incorporate a podium or any emblem, focusing instead on textual and illustrative elements related to public speaking.
